snippet: The governor of Maryland is doing something right in creating a commission to examine how law enforcement handles people with disabilities.
abstract: Editorial praises Maryland Gov Martin O'Malley for creating a commission to examine how law-enforcement officers, paramedics and others deal with people with intellectual and developmental disabilities; notes move stems from assault of Robert Ethan Saylor, who had Down syndrome and who died after Maryland sheriff's deputies moonlighting as mall security guards incompetently tried to force him to leave a movie theater.
lead_paragraph: The governor of Maryland is doing something right in creating a commission to examine how law enforcement handles people with disabilities.

headline.main: A Chance to Learn From a Senseless Death
